intro: Ternstroemia kanehirae, commonly known as the Kāneho`i or Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. Ternstroemia kanehirae is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of Hawaii and is often found in moist forest environments.
